Some of the background details of this story are based, very, very loosely, on real events of the era in which this was placed. The story combines elements of fiction and fantasy with reality.
The operational details from the D-Day invasion are very real.
Other parts of this book are only imaginary.
There is no central character, no central plot or story, and no underlying theme or purpose to this book. It just tells a story on a journey of some commonly made assumptions

This is a fine musical with a timeless score by one of my favorite composers (Gershwin) and a nice 'Parisien' atmosphere which gives the Boston Pops a chance to show its good jazz chops ,which they do with style. Aimiee or Sue Pierce would have been an excellent choice for the female lead had she not slipped away from the genre.
